reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were visiting family nearby and had not stayed at this property before. It is up-to-date, well-equipped, and has a friendly staff. Immaculate. (I did suggest that my east-facing room could use curtains that did a better job blocking the morning sun.) Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A really pleasant stay.

reviews.text: Although I am aware that Hampton Inns are typically clean and nice, I didn't know what to expect with this particular hotel, as it is in the middle of a very busy interchange, and I've been disappointed with NJ hotels in the past. This hotel far outmet all my expectations. My room was wonderful- it even smelled clean, with great bedding! The pool area was clean, and for those without a personal laptop, there is a computer in the lobby area which actually worked quite well. Breakfast was very good, as is usually expected in all Hampton Inns. I would stay here again in a flash!
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: We booked the Hampton Inn for the second year because it was so accomodating last year. At the time of booking(2 months before) we tried to also book a reservation for the Longhorn Steakhouse, which is attached to the hotel. I called several times and was always told "I have to speak to the manager" and they would call me back. Of course, they never did. But on the other hand, the hotel couldn't do enough for us. When we checked in we told the desk clerks (Iva and Jamie?) about this problem with the steakhouse. They told us to check back at 5:15 and they would take care of it. I don't have to tell anyone what a problem it is to get into a restaurant with 20 people on saturday night. When we checked back, they told us to be in the lobby at 6:15 and we would taken care of, and we were.
reviews.title: Fun family reunion

reviews.text: The hotel itself is clean and very well run. The breakfast could be better, but it is a hell of a lot better than trying to take 20 people out to breakfast, and is included in the room rate!! The pool was great. The water could have been a little warmer.
reviews.title: Functional

likes.liked: — I liked the value for the money and access to the highway.
likes.disliked: — Access to the highway is too good. You definitely need a car to get around.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the steakhouse was OK, some people liked it, and some didn't. The waiter we had (Chris?) did a very nice job handling 20 people. All in all it worked well, and we will be back again next year
reviews.title: Very Nice Hampton Inn!

likes.liked: — The spaciousness of the suite was a real plus; very clean; great staff
likes.disliked: — TRYING to go south on Route 9 -- not the hotel's fault!

reviews.text: I stayed for one night for a wedding and everything was perfect!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here before but perhaps things have gone down hill a bit.
reviews.title: So- So

reviews.text: Rooms are older style Hampton Inn. (versus the newer one we stayed in the night before in CT). the room had a perfumy smell which is usually a cover up for an older room and sure enough when the AC blew a musty smell came out. filters were clean so not sure where it came from.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the beds are on the firm side. the room had a refrig and microwave. rooms have internet but not wireless.
reviews.title: whats going on here?

reviews.text: breakfast room was large and had the usual stuff.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: It was a decent hotel, but there are just too many minorities staying there. There also seems to be people from the Ghetto drinking the free beer and wine when the manager has a reception from 5 to 7. Don't get a room on the side of route 9. You will be woken up by the sound of 18 wheelers at 5:30 am.
reviews.title: SO so

reviews.text: My husband stayed here for business for a week. I brought my children to visit overnight so that we could go to a nearby beach (their first vacation in 4 years). The children made some purchases at a theme restaurant and unfortunately left the bag in the hotel when we checked out. I don't THINK they did, I KNOW they did. I called the hotel as soon as we got home and the next day, desk staff took my name and housekeeping was supposed to get back to me. I had to keep calling adn even sent an email. I was ignored. The final time that I called I must have sounded angry because they emailed me back two days later...no bag of items found. So keep your belongings locked up because if the staff steals "found" items they are a step away from going through your bags. My husband is a member of the Hilton Honors Club but I have seen no honor here.
reviews.title: Don't expect the staff to pay attention to your complaints

reviews.text: I’ve stayed here several times. Nice hotel, each room has a micro fridge/microwave. Friendly front desk. Great firm mattresses. Nice bath amenities, above average breakfast with bananas, good selection of different yogurts. OK manager’s reception Mon Thurs with cheese and crackers, wine, draught beer, something hot. Longhorn Steakhouse is attached to the hotel which isn’t the greatest but in the winter and bad weather it’s a pretty welcome sight. Indoor pool. Internet is not real fast but better than many. Downsides: It kills me that hotels install these flat screen HD TV’s and then give you 23 lousy low def channels. At breakfast, they have “dueling TV’s” two different TV’s, each with the volume up and tuned to different channels. But, considering prices for NJ this is a good value and a reliable good night's sleep
reviews.title: Overall a Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We showed up at this Hampton Inn after driving all night. We asked to check in early because we were exhausted. They had no problem with this. We have gone to other hotels early and they made us sit in the lobby until check-in time even though the room was available. We were very grateful! The room was very comfortable and clean. The comforter and pillows were amazing, I'd like to know what kind they were so we can purchase them for our home. I would like to mention two women who worked at the front desk, Brittany and Stacie. They were so friendly and nice to us. I was pretty high maintenance that day asking a lot of questions about food in the area, etc. and they were never once annoyed by me. I really appreciate how nice they were and it is because of them that we will use this hotel anytime we have to be close to NYC. The price and service were just right! Not to mention the restaurant next door has fantastic food and is well priced. The filet mingon and lobster was only $26.95 and was delicious. Stay here. You will be as pleased as we were!
reviews.title: Extremely accomodating staff

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel when I was on a Business Trip. Its The hotel has good rooms, free breakfast and also has a shuttle service that drops you to any location within 5 miles. I reccomend it for Business travellersThere are a few good fast food chains and restaurants close to the hotel. The Woodbridge Mall is also close by.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've used this hotel before and it is convenient to both the Garden State and NJ Turnpike (and better yet, our grandson!). We use the smoking suite, and it is great -- very large living room/dining bar with small frig and microwave, and a separate bedroom, so if someone wants to stay up and watch TV or work on the computer, the other can hit the bed and watch a different show or sleep in. Longhorn Steakhouse is attached, so you can walk thru the lobby and dine conveniently or walk across the parking lot and hit a sports bar (no drinking and driving!). One short fall -- wireless is only available in the lobby! Come on, guys! This IS the 21st century!
reviews.title: Convenient -- suites are really nice

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel as a staging point for a move the following day to Hoboken. This Hampton Inn is an older property that was renovated. The lobby was spacious but upgraded to what I would consider lower business standards. Location is convenient being off a major road. A steak restaurant is attached to the hotel and can be accessed without going outside. A McDonalds and Walmart are also within walking distance. Being off a major road I was a bit considered about the security of the rental truck (Penske) I had driven up but had no issues. If I had driven a normal car I don't think I would have had any concerns.
reviews.title: Convenient location - So So Hampton Inn

reviews.text: The room itself was clean and up to the standards of a Hampton Inn. The carpet and wallpaper were older and it was obvious it was nearing it's end of life. The television was the older style CRT, I did pass many rooms with a newer LCD but for some reason I got a room with the CRT. The room itself had a king bed, television, wardrobe and couch. Noise wasn't too bad, I could hear the couple next door, umm, enjoying the amenities. Earplugs took care of that and I got a decent night's sleep.
reviews.title: A room at the inn...

reviews.text: I would stay here again if I had business in the area and there were no other comparable hotels. Even with the AAA discount I thought it was high priced compared to a Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Nice to find a great place when visiting family

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Woodbridge for one night last week on our way home from Virginia Beach. The Jersey Turnpike had been backed up for miles and after sitting on the highway for hours I knew it would not be wise to continue on to CT.
reviews.title: Disorganized staff, musty dark rooms
